channel.title: GitHub on Loving life and dreams.
channel.description: Recent content in GitHub on Loving life and dreams.

item.title: 02-25-Add-Sync-Gitee-Action
item.description:
1. Background

You were born as a programmer and certainly know the importance of backup. Besides, in the context of the current environment, the political relations in the United States are still rather chaotic, and for the projects stored on Github, it is no longer a country of technological freedom. So it’s still necessary for our code to have a “double” backup, and then we’ll show you how to use Action on Github to synchronize the code above Github to the Gitee warehouse site in China.

item.title: Github personal card

It’s not cumbersome to operate, as was the case with previous pages services, just prepare a specific repository, as follows:

item.title: Use Github, Travis CI to automatically deploy HexoCoding to OSChina Server
item.description:
Usually we use ‘hexo deploy’ locally to post blog posts to remote Pages servers, but don’t forget that we still need to submit code, so don’t feel a bit of trouble and score two steps to do it. Then it occurred to me whether the ‘Travis CI’ tool could be used to complete the deployment? The answer is yes, and the overall process is roughly as follows:

  • Edit articles locally (or on the Github website).
  • Submit an article to the Github server
  • Travis CI receives notifications to synchronize the latest Github code and execute user-customized ‘Travis’ scripts to generate static blogs
  • Finally push the generated blog to the specified Pages server

It’s just that one of the more troubling questions is how to protect our private keys, and if ‘Travis CI’ is ready for us, start our journey.

item.title: Github push failï¼šCould not resolve hostname
item.description:
Usually the most commonly used git push command suddenly can not be used (error log as follows), the brain first jumped out of the idea is: Is Github again by the wall! This has happened before and requires accelerated access by specifying hosts.

Error log returned after git push execution:

ssh: Could not resolve hostname github.com:elkan1788: nodename nor servname provided, or not known
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.
Please make sure you have the correct access rights
